articles.title: Apple's AI shakeup: They might not be 'moving the needle' on AI
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) is shaking up its AI executives, according to a Bloomberg report, as the tech giant prioritizes its artificial intelligence offerings. The company has delayed the launch of its AI-enhanced Siri digital assistant until 2026. TechRadar Editor-At-Large Lance Ulanoff sits down with Josh Lipton to talk more about Apple's strategy around AI and its integration into devices. A report from The Information also outlined how the iPhone maker is losing $1 billion each year on its Apple TV+ streaming service. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

articles.title: Apple, in effort to turn around Siri, shakes up executive ranks, Bloomberg says
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook lost faith in AI head John Giannandrea to execute on product development and drafted in Vision Pro creator Mike Rockwell to oversee Siri, Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman reports. In a new role, Rockwell will be in charge of the Siri virtual assistant and will report to software chief Craig Federighi, according to people familiar with the matter. Apple is expected to announce the changes to employees this week, Gurman writes. Rockwell is currently the vice president in charge of

articles.title: Accenture reports Q2 beat, Apple TV+ losing $1B annually: Morning Buzz
articles.content: The major indexes were fractionally higher near noon, continuing yesterday’s rally after the Federal Reserve held its benchmark interest rate steady on Wednesday, though Chair Jerome Powell noted there is “high uncertainty” about the potential impact of the Trump administration’s policies. Some solid housing data also allayed some worries about the U.S. economy potentially approaching a recession. articles.title: Report: Apple Reassigns Siri Development to Vision Pro Executive as AI Strategy Evolves
articles.content: Siri is no longer under AI chief John Giannandrea, amid delays in improvements until 2026.

articles.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
articles.content: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to supercharge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth with 300 million weekly active users. 2024 was a big year for OpenAI, from its partnership with Apple for its generative AI offering, Apple Intelligence, the release of GPT-4o with voice capabilities, and the highly-anticipated launch of its text-to-video

articles.title: Severance's Fame is Good for Apple TV+: Is it True for AAPL Stock?
articles.content: Severance's success bodes well for Apple's Services business. However, Apple Intelligence delays, stretched valuation, and China headwinds are concerns in 2025.

articles.title: Apple’s hearing aid software is impressive, but audiologists still matter
articles.content: An expert from the Royal National Institute for Deaf People is enthusiastic about the innovation but cautions about its medical limitations.
